entry.title: Bitcoin Core 29.2 Release Candidate 2 Available
entry.summary:
The latest release candidate for Bitcoin Core, version 29.2rc2, is now available for testing. Participants and interested parties can download the binaries from the official [Bitcoin Core website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.2/test.rc2/). For those who prefer to review or contribute to the source code directly, it is accessible under a signed tag at the project's [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v29.2rc2).
This update signifies a minor version release in the ongoing development of Bitcoin Core. Developers and users are encouraged to consult the preliminary release notes to understand the changes and improvements made in this version. The release notes provide detailed information and are available [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v29.2rc2/doc/release-notes.md).
Release candidates like version 29.2rc2 play a crucial role in the software development process, serving as test versions before the final release. The feedback gathered during this phase helps identify any critical issues that need resolution. Assuming no significant problems arise, this candidate will advance to become the official v29.2 release.
The notification about this release was distributed to subscribers of the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, indicating its significance to developers and members of the Bitcoin community who follow the progression of the software closely. This step marks an important phase in ensuring the stability and reliability of Bitcoin Core, reflecting the collaborative effort of the development community to refine and enhance the platform.
